project.name: Kernel
project.description: The Kernel Security subproject is tasked with keeping all kernel sources secure.

longdescription.p: Gentoo Linux Kernel Security Project handles patching our many kernel sources and informing our users about global kernel security status.

body.warn: Please note, that the Kernel Security Project is more or less inactive at the moment and that the information given here may not be not up to date.
body.p: If you are interested in helping with kernel security handling, please contact the Security Team.

tr.ti: This kernel contains patches that likely will never make it into mainline Linux; as such, it's not something that can continue to be supported.

body.p: Adding a new kernel source into the tree is not recommended by the Gentoo Security Team. Unless it is a kernel source you think could be used by a wide number of users, please end your consideration here and simply use an overlay. If you do believe that it is, you must be willing to become the security maintainer. Being the security maintainer for a kernel source means being willing to devote a significant amount of time to closing security bugs for that kernel source. Additionally, you must take care that your kernel source never falls into hardmasking. If it does, your kernel source will automatically lose Gentoo Security support, and may be subject to tree removal.
